## GAD-7 vs CAGE

The comparison of psychological assessment instruments like GAD-7 and the CAGE questionnaire is pivotal for comprehensive research in the field of mental health. The Generalised Anxiety Disorder 7 (GAD-7) and CAGE are two different instruments used to assess generalized anxiety disorder and problematic alcohol consumption respectively. Bringing into play the GAD-7 vs CAGE comparison could shed light on co-occurring mental disorders and aid in creating comprehensive treatment plans. However, the process of comparing and harmonising these questionnaires can be arduous without the right tools. This is where the Harmony software comes in hand providing a hassle-free and error-free environment for comparing these questionnaires. As a sophisticated tool developed for psychologists, Harmony employs generative AI models and natural language processing to ensure accurate harmonisation of items in different questionnaires, even in different languages, making GAD-7 vs CAGE comparisons a breeze. We highly recommend using Harmony for a GAD-7 vs CAGE analysis by simply selecting these instruments from Harmony's database or by dragging and dropping your own instruments in PDF form into Harmony's web interface. Harmony's large language models could provide a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and CAGE, thereby streamlining your research process and providing more accurate results. Utilize Harmony for a more productive GAD-7 vs CAGE comparison.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and CAGE

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and CAGE into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_" target="harmonyapp">Import just CAGE into Harmony</a> - compare CAGE with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
